channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: LIVE Coverage: State of the Nation Address 2020
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: Will he bare the government's recovery plan as the Philippines is facing a health crisIs and economic instability?

item.title: Villar: 150 facilities constructed, repurposed for COVID-19
item.description: Department of Public Works and Highways Secretary Mark Villar on Thursday said a total of 150 facilities constructed and repurposed by the department are now being used as facilities for quarantine, isolation and off-site dormitories of COVID-19 patients and frontline workers.

item.title: Project ARK partners with Metro mayors for pooled testing
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: A number of Metro Manila mayors expressed their support for the pooled swab testing strategy of Go Negosyo Project ARK during a virtual presser of the presentation of initial rapid test results in the cities of Mandaluyong, Muntinlupa, Navotas, San Mateo, Parañaque and Pasay yesterday.

item.title: Cayetano to honor term-sharing deal on speakership
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano said yesterday he would step down from his post in November and honor the term-sharing agreement with Marinduque Rep. Lord Allan Velasco.

item.title: Go pushes local production of face masks
item.description: In line with an earlier appeal for the government to enforce a stronger face mask-wearing policy, Sen. Bong Go is also urging concerned agencies to promote and patronize local production of protective masks.

item.title: Nothing wrong with employing chismosos — DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health sees nothing wrong with tapping the neighborhood “chismoso” and “chismosa” to do contact tracing of people who could have interacted with individuals infected with COVID-19.

item.title: IATF allows resumption of physician licensure tests in September
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases has approved the holding of the Physician Licensure Examination, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: Locsin orders DFA to facilitate entry of foreign fiancés
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: The Philippines’ top diplomat instructed the Department of Foreign Affairs legal office to “find all ways” for fiancés of Filipinos to travel and enter the Philippines as travel restrictions continue to delay their weddings.

item.title: Anti-terror law petitions pile up at Supreme Court
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 is gaining more opposition before the Supreme Court, with three more petitions seeking to halt its implementation filed yesterday morning, making it the most highly contested law ain the SC with 19 petitions so far.

item.title: Philippines joins global vaccine alliance vs COVID-19
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: To give the country more access to treatment and vaccines, the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases has approved the participation of the Philippines in the Gavi COVID-19 Vaccines Global Access facility.
